intro: Galium trichocarpon, commonly known as the hairy bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Galium trichocarpon is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and along stream banks.
